prefuse.controls

Class PanControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • prefuse.controls.ControlAdapter
      • prefuse.controls.PanControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, EventListener, Control

    public class PanControl
extends ControlAdapter
    Pans the display, changing the viewable region of the visualization. By default, panning is accomplished by clicking on the background of a visualization with the left mouse button and then dragging.
    Author:
    jeffrey heer

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface prefuse.controls.Control

        LEFT_MOUSE_BUTTON, MIDDLE_MOUSE_BUTTON, RIGHT_MOUSE_BUTTON

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • PanControl

        public PanControl()
        Create a new PanControl.

      • PanControl

        public PanControl(boolean panOverItem)
        Create a new PanControl.
        Parameters:
        panOverItem - if true, the panning control will work even while the mouse is over a visual item.

      • PanControl

        public PanControl(int mouseButton)
        Create a new PanControl.
        Parameters:
        mouseButton - the mouse button that should initiate a pan. One of Control.LEFT_MOUSE_BUTTON, Control.MIDDLE_MOUSE_BUTTON, or Control.RIGHT_MOUSE_BUTTON.

      • PanControl

        public PanControl(int mouseButton,
                  boolean panOverItem)
        Create a new PanControl
        Parameters:
        mouseButton - the mouse button that should initiate a pan. One of Control.LEFT_MOUSE_BUTTON, Control.MIDDLE_MOUSE_BUTTON, or Control.RIGHT_MOUSE_BUTTON.
        panOverItem - if true, the panning control will work even while the mouse is over a visual item.
